code.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a set of rules, laws, or principles that tell people how to behave
code.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The Torah is the basis for all the Jewish laws and their moral code.
Each state in the US has a different criminal and civil code.
The judge ruled that there had been no breach of the code.
There were plans to introduce a dress code (=rules about what to wear) for civil servants.
the strict code of conduct that is so much a part of karate
The Textile Services Association has drawn up a code of practice endorsed by the Office of Fair Trading.
code.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a system of words, letters, or symbols that you use instead of ordinary writing, so that the information can only be understood by someone else who knows the system
code.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: They didn’t realise that we’d broken their secret code.
All reports must be sent in code.
code.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a set of numbers, letters, or symbols that shows what something is or gives information about it
code.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Goods that you order must have a product code.
Every item found on the archaeological dig is given a code number.
code.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the group of numbers that comes before a telephone number when you are calling from a different area
code.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a set of instructions that tell a computer what to do
code.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a system of sounds or signals that represent words or letters when they are sent by machine
code.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a set of rules, laws, or principles that tell people how to behave
code.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: a code of practice/conduct/ethics
There is a strict code of conduct for doctors.
a code of behaviour
Each tribe follows its own code of behaviour.
a code of honour
The family’s code of honour meant that they had to take revenge.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + code
a moral code
Children acquire their parents’ moral code.
a legal code
the legal code on the use of pesticides
a penal/criminal code
At that time the penal code allowed the death penalty.
a dress code
Some of the more expensive clubs have a dress code.
the Highway Code
You will be tested on your knowledge of the Highway Code.
a strict code
In future we will have to abide by a strict code of environmental standards.
a voluntary code
This voluntary code sets standards for retailers on the use of child labour.
have a code
Most professional organizations have a code of ethics.
create/produce/establish a code
They have established a code of practice for advertisers.
draw up/lay down a code
The syndicate decided to draw up a code of conduct for its members.
follow a code
When children are near water, it’s important to follow a basic safety code.
comply with/adhere to/conform to  a code
All staff must sign and strictly adhere to a Code of Business Ethics.
break a code
European steel producers were judged to be breaking the code.
breach/violate/contravene a code
Any companies breaching the code will be expelled from the Association.
code.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a system of words, letters, or symbols that you use instead of ordinary writing, so that the information can only be understood by someone else who knows the system
code.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: the secret codes used during the two world wars
The Enigma machine was used to crack the enemy codes.
His job involved deciphering the codes used by the enemy.
All the information we received during the war was written in code.
The message was sent in code to the task force, as a signal to attack.
UMBRA was the code word for top secret information.
The spy was referred to in the report only by his code name 'Trevor S'.
code.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to put a set of numbers, letters, or symbols on something to show what it is or give information about it
code.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Each path is coded to show the level of difficulty.
The researcher codes them X or Y.
code.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to put a message into code so that it is secret
code.translation[1].definitions[1].note_: Code is usually passive in this meaning
code.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: I think kids should be taught how to code.
code.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a complete set of written rules or laws
code.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Each state in the US has a different criminal and civil code.
code.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a set of numbers, letters, or signs that are used to show what something is or give information about it
code.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: It is all too easy to miss an employee off a list because a code has been entered incorrectly.
code.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: a set of instructions that tell a computer what to do
code.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: a translator that will take the binary code from Windows applications and produce Alpha code
An ANDF version of the spreadsheet runs to 200,000 lines of code.
code.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: the group of numbers that come before a telephone number when you are calling from a different area
code.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: Dial 0101 first, then your area code, followed by your home number.
code.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: a number that is given to an employee showing the amount of money that they are allowed to earn without paying any tax
code.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: When you get married your code will change.
